channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Ukraine war: No quick return to normal for scarred Bucha
item.description: Everything has changed in this town since the Russians came, and horrific memories will not easily be erased.

item.title: Russian warship: Moskva sinks in Black Sea
item.description: The warship sank while being towed a day after Ukraine claimed to have hit it with a missile.

item.title: Ukraine round-up: Russia sends warning to US
item.description: Russia attacks Kyiv factory and warns of consequences if US keeps arming Ukraine.

item.title: Ukraine's battle for control of its skies
item.description: A Ukrainian air defence officer tells the BBC: "Whoever dominates the air wins the war."

item.title: Climate change: Key UN finding widely misinterpreted
item.description: Suggestions emissions could rise for another three years without dangerous warming are wrong, scientists say.

item.title: Covid China: Elderly deaths contradict Shanghai figures
item.description: Official figures claim there have been no Covid deaths in the current outbreak.

item.title: Tropical Storm Megi: Landslides and floods kill 167 in Philippines
item.description: Tropical Storm Megi devastated the country on Sunday, with houses washed out to sea in one village.

item.title: Undocumented lotto winner struggles to claim prize
item.description: An Algerian man in Belgium is fighting to claim his €250,000 winnings because of his status.

item.title: Twitter board takes action to fight Musk bid
item.description: The so-called "poison pill" measure is in response to Elon Musk's $43bn cash buyout offer.

item.title: Durban flood survivors: South Africans homeless, hurt and heartbroken
item.description: "We're traumatised, we can't even eat," one South African woman says after her house was destroyed.

item.title: Arizona man arrested after dogs, cats and snakes found in home freezer
item.description: Police say photos of the frozen dogs, lizards, snakes and other animals are too graphic to release.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Save energy and annoy Putin, Germans told
item.description: The vice-chancellor says they should use bikes and lower the thermostat to use less Russian gas.

item.title: Salah Abdeslam: Accused Paris attacker apologises to victims
item.description: Salah Abdeslam was allegedly part of an IS terror cell that killed 130 people in attacks across Paris in 2015.

item.title: DR Congo conflict: Hiding on top of a hill to escape the rebels
item.description: Some 50,000 people have found a place of sanctuary from the myriad armed groups in eastern DR Congo.

item.title: Week in pictures: 9-15 April 2022
item.description: A selection of striking images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

item.title: Merle Oberon: India's forgotten Hollywood star
item.description: Merle Oberon rose to stardom in the West while furtively hiding the truth of her past in India.

item.title: Sanctioned Russian oligarchs linked to £800m worth of UK property
item.description: A dozen sanctioned Russians are linked to an estimated £800m worth of property in the UK, BBC analysis reveals.

item.title: Durban floods: Is it a consequence of climate change?
item.description: KwaZulu-Natal province has seen some serious flooding, but there isn't one clear explanation.

item.title: Why people get away with hate speech in India
item.description: As hate speech cases make headlines, experts say the problem isn't lack of laws but political will.

item.title: Behind the scenes in Zelensky's modern HQ
item.description: Clive Myrie visits the heavily fortified Situation Room - the HQ of the resistance against Russia's invasion.

item.title: Chernihiv is silent, after having been under constant attack from Russian forces
item.description: The Ukrainian city of Chernihiv was under constant attack until suddenly Russian forces withdrew.

item.title: Ukraine war: Minesweeping dog helps clear Chernihiv of Russian explosives
item.description: Patron, a Jack Russell, has so far helped to remove hundreds of explosive devices.

item.title: US zoo celebrates 50 years of giant pandas
item.description: The tradition of gifted pandas to the US from China hits a 50-year mark at Washington DC's National Zoo.

item.title: Former Twitter exec questions seriousness of Musk offer
item.description: Vivian Schiller, who used to work there, tells Newsnight Elon Musk enjoys "throwing bombs" on Twitter.

item.title: Zelensky: Countries buying Russian oil are earning money in other people's blood
item.description: Ukraine's president says countries buying Russian oil are "making money out of blood".
